response.overview: In half-disused workshops of the Ethiopian railway, railway workers Goshou, Berhanu and Basha, try to maintain their machine alive on a daily basis. To travel the 207 kilometers of the path through the desert, it takes more than ten hours, sometimes more. Sometimes, the train doesn't leave. Just around the corner, a new electrified line constructed by China threaten to make this historical line fall into oblivion.
response.title: Chemin de terre
